messages.content: What does the a-person-mask-generator extension do?
The a-person-mask-generator extension automatically creates masks for Background/Hair/Body/Face/Clothes in Img2Img.
Which model does the a-person-mask-generator use?
It uses the [Multi-class selfie segmentation model](https://developers.google.com/mediapipe/solutions/vision/image_segmenter#multiclass-model) model by Google.
How do you install the a-person-mask-generator for Automatic1111 Web UI?

You should follow the steps provided from opening 'Extensions' tab, then 'Install from URL' tab, entering the extension repository URL, pressing 'Install', waiting, checking 'Installed' tab, clicking 'Check for updates' and 'Apply and restart UI', and then completely restarting A1111 web UI including your terminal.
How do you install the a-person-mask-generator for ComfyUI?
You should navigate to your ComfyUI folder, into the 'custom_nodes' folder in a 'CMD' window, run 'git clone https://github.com/djbielejeski/a-person-mask-generator', and then restart ComfyUI.
What are the mask types available in a-person-mask-generator examples?
The mask types available are Face, Face + Body, Clothes + Hair, and Mask Settings
What is the order of masks in the ComfyUI example workflow?
The order of masks in the ComfyUI example workflow is Face, Background, Body + Clothes, Hair.
